replies.body:
Can mods remove these stats posts from Gameplay?

They’re absolutely low effort.

There is always going to be a champion with a semi decent winrate and pickrate.

You nerf Kassadin and 2 other mid laners take his place and then comes another forum poster saying “Mage has x% wr with a y% playrate, nerf thnx”

This isn’t constructive.

You have a point, but Kass has such a god like 3 item phase without really being punished with having a terrible early game.  Its not great, but for how strong he is past 25 minutes, his pre ten should be worse.

Combine that with all of his damage being incapable of dodging and you have a ticking time bomb of trying to put your team so far ahead of the kass that he is unable to engage once he gets his items.   Which is really poor gameplay design.

I have no clue who’s downvoting these posts within minutes, but I just wanna mention that I think Kass is strong right now, these kinds of threads don’t discuss WHY.

I don’t think he warrants nerfs, yet. He supposed to be a scaling champion. He can’t be blind picked because AD assassins ruin his day. A lot of players are terrible at building him for what the team needs and will gimp him by going RoA and Tear every game.

But my issue is - what made Kass strong and what nerfs would one like to see? His bases aren’t impressive. His scaling is the whole point of picking Kassadin.

Nothing in the OP addresses this. It’s just pointless, stat reading, upvoting whoring bullshit that plagues these forums.

He stated a fact. If he has ideas for fixes good, but if not you can´t blame him. In the end it´s not his job to balance the game. Also let´s say a champion would be overpowered in for example bronze only. It would be a problem nontheless.

In my opinion his ultimate is the biggest problem. Low cooldown, high mobility and damage essentially only gated by mana. Although I´m not a kassadin player I´d suggest to change the way Riftwalk resets works:

Instead of a full reset after 15sec there should be a decrease by one stack at a time. This would bring his cooldown management in line with other ultimate abilities but also provides dps/mana control for the player.

Normally I roll my eyes whenever I see your comments but this might be the first time I agree with you completely.

Kassadin still doesn't do any pre 6 and even post 6 he still needs certain items to get the ball rolling.

His his early game is still pretty bad to weak with few good match ups. The only thing that finally changed imo Kassadin finally being able to get out laning phase without getting destroyed if you are good enough while the enemy laner finally not having basically full control of the lane early game.
Which is why you pick FF on Kass.

It is situational but realistically speaking your going to taking in almost every lane because very few are forgiving enough to get away with it. You still give up a lot as well by Precision first. The first and second row are border line useless on Kass and your taking attack speed over AP.

Plus this whole time your still playing an assassin. Kassadin mid to late game is great compared to most assassins who fall off much harder. But even then he still can't wave clear and he doesn't provide that much CC. So yah he does feel that loss of damage by going Precision. And unlike Veigar he isn't ranged or scale indefinitely.


Edit: plus itemizing as Kassadin still feels awful. He doesn't feel good until you have items that actually augment his play style with very few components that feel good to have before the item is completed.

The problem with Kassadin is. He won't kill leblanc in lane for sure, and that is true. the issue is that Leblanc NEEDS to snowball to win game, while Kassadin only needs to scale. So whatever the move you will do, it will always result in Kassadin being able to scale up freely.

oh and btw, Kassadin spikes "early" in the game, and can 100-0 people once he gets {{item:3027}}  and {{item:3100}}. not to say that when he splits pushes, he can't really be caught, which once again reduces the farm denying potential on him.

I got to say that everytime I plat against Kassadin, I think of how broken his late game is, and how hard I have to crush him early game. So it frustrates me quite a lot when I see that I can't get him out of lane super easily because of his innate sustain vs magic poke damage ( I don't play AD champions at all). 

He is actually super good at splitpushing. He indeed can't push tower/creeps super fast, just that he is uncatchable. And it does matter quite a lot. Leblanc is good plitpusher cause she can't be caught, and is a strong duelist. 

His utility late game? oneshotting a carry with 1 spell rotation (and ~~all~~ most of them aren't even dodgeable) , then escape with a spell that has a 1 sec cooldown. I think that is quite ok :)

Once again, I wouldn't say that Kassadin is oppresive in the sense that he can't really kill me in a pure 1V1 scenario. However, it just feels like facing a Nasus : you know how harsh your mid/late game will be if you don't crush him fast enough. And the gap you need to make to be relevant against Kassadin is just too huge to be done alone, especially in soloQ where you can't play your lane 1v1, as the jungler will always come and pick up the free kill. 

about complaining, I can't agree more. however, there are some champions that are, imho, not reliably counterplayable. Kassadin is one of those. I have tried many things, many champions that are supposed to be doing well against him, and what I understand from this is that you have to face to face a smurf to die as Kassadin in lane pre6 in an 1V1 scenario. champ is not weak enough in lane for how strong he becomes.
